intro: Perityle congesta, commonly known as the clustered perityle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Perityle congesta thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
